column1: Forlong was the Lord of Lossarnach during the War of the Ring.
Forlong was famed for both his girth and his vitality at old age
column2: which led the people of Minas Tirith to refer to him as both "Forlong the Fat" and "Forlong the Old".

column1: Forlong rode to the aid of Minas Tirith with two hundred of his men. His men bore great battle-axes and were well-armed. Forlong fought bravely in the Battle of the Pelennor Fields
column2: but the opposition proved too strong. Separated from his men and his horse slain
column3: Forlong was killed. He was remembered in the Song of the Mounds of Mundburg.

column1: Forlong was a Pre-Númenórean name of unknown meaning.
